sentences: Camilo Echeverry (born 16 March 1994), known mononymously as Camilo, is a Colombian singer, musician and songwriter.
He is known for his singles "Favorito", "Tutu", alongside Pedro Capó and Shakira, and "Desconocidos", with Mau y Ricky and Manuel Turizo.
His music is generally categorized as Latin pop with a mix of urbano and is noted for his romantic lyrics and soprano voice.
Debuted in 2008, after winning the talent show Factor XS in 2007.
He is also known for writing and producing hits for other artists including Becky G and Natti Natasha's "Sin Pijama" and Bad Bunny's "Si Estuviésemos Juntos".
His accolades include five Latin Grammy Awards and two Grammy Award nominations.

sentences: Musical style ==
Camilo describes himself as "an honest singer who uses love as a reason for his songs."
His music is generally characterized as Latin pop and reggaeton.
Suzette Fernandez of Billboard labeled his music as "romantic pop songs fused with urban beats".
His vocals have been described as "distinctly delicate".
He cites Uruguayan singer Jorge Drexler as a major influence on his work.
He is also noted for his positivity on social media.

Lucas Villa of MTV described his Instagram feed as "a Latinx Hallmark card filled with positive messages of hope", exemplified by his bio section consisting of "AMAR ES MI REVOLUCIÓN" ("Love is my revolution").
Personal life ==
In February 2020, he married Evaluna Montaner, daughter of the Argentine-Venezuelan singer and songwriter Ricardo Montaner and sister of the Venezuelan duo Mau y Ricky.
In October 2021, the couple announced that they were expecting their first child in their latest single "Índigo".
According to sources, that is the name they have chosen for their unborn child.
